com.blahti.example.drag2

Class DropSpot

  • java.lang.Object
    • ViewGroup
      • com.blahti.example.drag2.MyAbsoluteLayout
        • com.blahti.example.drag2.DropSpot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DropTarget

    public class DropSpot
extends MyAbsoluteLayout
implements DropTarget
    This class describes an area within a DragLayer where a dragged item can be dropped. It is a subclass of MyAbsoluteLayout, which means that it is a ViewGroup and views can be added as child views.

    In the onDrop method, the view dropped is not added as a child view. Instead, the view is repositioned within the DragLayer that contains the DropSpot. If the DropSpot is not associated with a DragLayer, it will not accept dropped objects.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • onDrop

        public void onDrop(DragSource source,
          int x,
          int y,
          int xOffset,
          int yOffset,
          DragView dragView,
          java.lang.Object dragInfo)
        Handle an object being dropped on the DropTarget. This is the where a dragged view gets repositioned at the end of a drag.
        Specified by:
        onDrop in interface DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - DragSource where the drag started
        x - X coordinate of the drop location
        y - Y coordinate of the drop location
        xOffset - Horizontal offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        yOffset - Vertical offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        dragView - The DragView that's being dragged around on screen.
        dragInfo - Data associated with the object being dragged

      • acceptDrop

        public boolean acceptDrop(DragSource source,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int xOffset,
                 int yOffset,
                 DragView dragView,
                 java.lang.Object dragInfo)
        Check if a drop action can occur at, or near, the requested location. This may be called repeatedly during a drag, so any calls should return quickly.
        Specified by:
        acceptDrop in interface DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - DragSource where the drag started
        x - X coordinate of the drop location
        y - Y coordinate of the drop location
        xOffset - Horizontal offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        yOffset - Vertical offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        dragView - The DragView that's being dragged around on screen.
        dragInfo - Data associated with the object being dragged
        Returns:
        True if the drop will be accepted, false otherwise.

      • estimateDropLocation

        public Rect estimateDropLocation(DragSource source,
                        int x,
                        int y,
                        int xOffset,
                        int yOffset,
                        DragView dragView,
                        java.lang.Object dragInfo,
                        Rect recycle)
        Estimate the surface area where this object would land if dropped at the given location.
        Specified by:
        estimateDropLocation in interface DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - DragSource where the drag started
        x - X coordinate of the drop location
        y - Y coordinate of the drop location
        xOffset - Horizontal offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        yOffset - Vertical offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        dragView - The DragView that's being dragged around on screen.
        dragInfo - Data associated with the object being dragged
        recycle - Rect object to be possibly recycled.
        Returns:
        Estimated area that would be occupied if object was dropped at the given location. Should return null if no estimate is found, or if this target doesn't provide estimations.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Return true if this DropSpot is hooked up to a DragLayer. If it is, it means that it will accept dropped views.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • setup

        public void setup(DragLayer layer,
         DragController controller,
         int initialColor)
        Set up the drop spot by connecting it to a drag layer and a drag controller. When this method completes, the drop spot is listed as one of the drop targets of the controller and the drop spot is also set as a DragListener. If the dragLayer is null, the drop spot is set initially in a state where nothing can be dropped on it.
        Parameters:
        layer - DragLayer
        controller - DragController
        initialColor - int - resource id of the initial background color
